marketNews.title: IHSG +1.16%, ADRO 1H24: Thermal Coal Sales Volume +5% YoY. News Compilation for Today.
marketNews.content: IHSG rose +1.16%, ADRO 1H24: Thermal Coal Sales Volume +5% YoY. News Compilation for today. August 7, 2024. IHSG 7,212 +1.16% Coal 150.8 +1.07% Oil (Brent) 77.2 +0.30% Gold 2,435 +0.15% CPO 3,694 -0.30% Nickel 16,385 +0.67% Confused about the meaning of these numbers? Check this out. Stockbitor! The executive director of the Center of Reform on Economics Indonesia, Mohammad Faisal, told Kompas that the household consumption growth (+4.93% YoY) being lower than Indonesia's economic growth (+5.05% YoY) in 2Q24 was influenced by the declining purchasing power of the middle class. Therefore, Faisal stated that the government must be more careful not to issue policies that could further suppress the middle class, such as the plan to increase VAT to 12% and expand excise objects. On the other hand, the Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, assessed that the realization of household consumption in 2Q24 was a sufficiently high result. The Chairman of the Commercial Affairs Division of the Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI), Sigit Kumala, said that his party revised the domestic motorcycle sales target for 2024 from the range of 6.2-6.5 million units to 6.2-6.3 million units. This revision was caused by weak domestic motorcycle sales during 1H24, which fell -0.97% YoY to 3.17 million units. Sigit explained that the decline in domestic motorcycle sales was pressured by weakening public purchasing power in line with soaring food inflation and the benchmark interest rate still being at a high level. Kontan reported that business circles and economic observers advised the government to reintroduce income tax (PPh) incentives for employees. This step is aimed at maintaining public purchasing power, especially for the middle class, which has recently continued to weaken. Previously, the government provided borne by the government PPh incentives in April 2020-December 2021 for employees with gross income less than 200 million per year. The Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, stated that the elected president, Prabowo Subianto, plans to announce his cabinet composition on October 21, 2024, or one day after being inaugurated. Bank Indonesia recorded that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves as of the end of July 2024 rose to 145.4 billion US dollars (vs. June 2024: 140.2 billion US dollars). This increase was influenced by the government's issuance of global sukuk as well as tax and service receipts. The position of foreign exchange reserves is equivalent to financing 6.5 months of imports or 6.3 months of imports and government foreign debt payments. The Minister of Finance, Sri Mulyani, re-established the policy of imposing safeguard measures import duties (BMTP) on imported fabric, carpet, and other floor covering textile products. These BMTP will start on August 9, 2024, and will be valid for 3 years. This policy previously expired in 2022, but was re-enacted following complaints from the domestic textile industry which found it difficult to compete due to cheap imported products.

tickerNews.title: EXCL 1H24: Net Profit +58% YoY, Exceeding Expectations
tickerNews.content: XL Axiata ($EXCL) recorded a net profit of 486 billion rupiah (+8% YoY, -10% QoQ) in 2Q24. This result brought the net profit for 1H24 to 1 trillion rupiah (+58% YoY), exceeding expectations as it equates to 57% of the consensus FY24F estimate. Operationally, EXCL's performance in 2Q24 looked strong with operating profit growth (+12% YoY, +0.3% QoQ). This result caused the operating profit for 1H24 to rise +34% YoY, exceeding expectations as it equates to 53% of the consensus FY24 estimate. Operationally, the number of mobile customers grew to 58.5 million (+1% YoY, +2% QoQ) in 2Q24. Meanwhile, the average revenue per mobile segment customer (ARPU) stabilized at 44 thousand rupiah (+5% YoY, 0% QoQ), even though marketing expenses and general and administrative expenses decreased year-on-year. These results caused EXCL s profitability margin to strengthen during 1H24. EXCL management stated in the earnings call on Wednesday (7/8) that customer growth and ARPU were the results of the company's investment to improve network quality in cities where EXCL's market share is still small. Looking ahead, management expects marketing expenses to increase in 2H24 due to seasonal factors and competition. Furthermore, the company is also preparing to become the market leader in terms of ARPU through a payment integration strategy via the application. Although performance during 1H24 was better than estimates, EXCL management still maintained the FY24 guidance provided at the beginning of the year. This is due to the uncertain business competition situation. The following are details of EXCL management's guidance for FY24: Revenue growth: high single-digit EBITDA Margin: ~50% Capex: 8 trillion rupiah Management also conveyed that EXCL's financial report has not included the fixed broadband business integration factor from Link Net ($LINK) because the timeline can change due to administrative factors. Key Takeaway We assess EXCL's short-term outlook will depend on several factors, such as the execution of the company's strategy in maintaining ARPU growth and customer numbers. EXCL's ARPU gap with competitors which is no longer large (vs. TLKM: 45 thousand rupiah, ISAT: 38 thousand rupiah) in 2Q24 makes growth more challenging. On the other hand, we are also wary of several surprising factors that could influence EXCL's stock price movement in the near term, such as 1) the integration of LINK's revenue and net profit into EXCL's financial statements; and 2) progress in the EXCL and FREN merger development.

tickerNews.title: $ADRO: Adaro Energy Indonesia Recorded Coal Production Volume of 17.66 Million Tons in 2Q24
tickerNews.content: ADRO: Adaro Energy Indonesia recorded a coal production volume of 17.66 million tons (-2% QoQ, 0% YoY) in 2Q24, so the production volume during 1H24 reached 35.74 million tons (+7% YoY). Thermal coal sales volume reached 16.92 million tons (+10% QoQ, +6% YoY) in 2Q24, so the thermal coal sales volume during 1H24 reached 32.35 million tons (+5% YoY). Meanwhile, metallurgical coal sales through its subsidiary, Adaro Minerals Indonesia ($ADMR) reached 1.54 million tons (+47% QoQ, +59% YoY) in 2Q24, bringing the metallurgical coal sales volume during 1H24 to 2.59 million tons (+43% YoY). Furthermore, ADRO's stripping ratio in 2Q24 reached 4.27x (vs. 1Q24: 3.66x, 2Q23: 4.14x), so for 1H24 it reached 3.96x (vs. 1H23: 3.88x).

tickerNews.title: $MDKA: Merdeka Copper Gold Recorded Gold Sales Volume of 25 Thousand Ounces in 2Q24
tickerNews.content: MDKA: Merdeka Copper Gold recorded a gold sales volume of 25 thousand ounces (-6% QoQ, -15% YoY) in 2Q24, with a sales value of 56.6 million US dollars (+1% QoQ, -2% YoY). This result brought the gold sales volume during 1H24 to reach 51.6 thousand ounces (+4% YoY), with a sales value of 112.7 million US dollars (+17% YoY). Meanwhile, copper sales volume reached 2 thousand tons (-53% QoQ, -53% YoY) in 2Q24, with a sales value of 18.7 million US dollars (-48% QoQ, -49% YoY). This result brought the copper sales volume during 1H24 to reach 6.3 thousand tons (-20% YoY), with a sales value of 54.7 million US dollars (-21% YoY).

tickerNews.title: $MBMA: Merdeka Battery Materials Recorded NPI Sales Volume of 20.8 Thousand Tons in 2Q24
tickerNews.content: MBMA: Merdeka Battery Materials recorded NPI sales volume of 20.8 thousand tons (-4% QoQ, +89% YoY) in 2Q24, with a sales value of 240.5 million US dollars (+1% QoQ, +54% YoY). This result brought the NPI sales volume during 1H24 to reach ~42.5 thousand tons (+121% YoY), with a sales value of 479.5 million US dollars (+60% YoY). MBMA also recorded nickel matte sales volume reaching 12.8 thousand tons (-11% QoQ, +322% YoY) in 2Q24, with a sales value of 189.8 million US dollars (-4% QoQ, +258% YoY). This result brought the nickel matte sales volume during 1H24 to reach 27.2 thousand tons (+796% YoY), with a sales value of 386.7 million US dollars (+630% YoY). Meanwhile, limonite ore sales volume reached ~2.9 million wmt (+360% QoQ) in 2Q24, with a sales value of 47.2 million US dollars (+477% QoQ). This result brought the limonite ore sales volume during 1H24 to reach ~3.5 million wmt, with a sales value of 55.5 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: $PSSI: IMC Pelita Logistik to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend of 146.7 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: PSSI: IMC Pelita Logistik will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 146.7 billion rupiah or 28 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is August 8, 2024, while payment is scheduled for August 30, 2024. Referring to the PSSI share price at the close of trading on Wednesday (7/8) at the level of 458 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 6.1%.

tickerNews.title: $RAAM: Tripar Multivision Plus Plans Private Placement Up to 10% of Shares
tickerNews.content: RAAM: Tripar Multivision Plus plans to conduct a private placement of up to 619.4 million (10%) shares with a dilution effect of up to 9.09%. The execution price and prospective investors have not been announced, while the funds obtained are intended for business development through investment. This plan will be discussed at the GMS Extraordinary Meeting on September 12, 2024.

tickerNews.title: $MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend of 76 Billion Rupiah
tickerNews.content: MARK: Mark Dynamics Indonesia will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 76 billion rupiah or 20 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date in the regular and negotiation market is August 15, 2024, while payment is scheduled for September 6, 2024. Referring to the MARK share price at the close of trading on Wednesday (7/8) at the level of 935 rupiah per share, the indicated dividend yield is 2.1%.

tickerNews.title: $MTEL: Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Revises Optimistic Fiber Optic Target Upward, But Downward on Tenant Target
tickerNews.content: The Investment Director of Dayamitra Telekomunikasi, Hendra Purnama, said that his party is revising the target for adding fiber optic in 2024 upward from 10 thousand km to 14 thousand km. Meanwhile, MTEL is revising down the target for adding tenants in 2024 from 4 thousand to 3 thousand. With this target change, the tenancy ratio is targeted to reach 1.56x (vs. 1H24 realization: 1.52x). For 2024 itself, MTEL targets revenue and EBITDA growth of high single-digit.

tickerNews.title: Trinitan Metals and Minerals ($PURE) Targets Commissioning of New Machine in 3Q24 to Increase Capacity to 2,200 Tons Per Day
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Cerestar Indonesia ($TRGU), Indra Irawan, said that his party is targeting the commissioning of a new machine at the Gresik factory to be carried out in 3Q24. The new machine will increase TRGU's production capacity by 600 tons per day to 2,200 tons per day.
